info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 3:21PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mesa County through 345 PM MDT... At 321 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grand Junction, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Grand Junction around 330 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Palisade. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 24 and 48. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 43. Colorado 141 between mile markers 152 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
